inclusion.criterion: study staff member will describe the study and offer participation
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: sign research protocol and HIPAA consent forms
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: receive a copy of these forms
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patient's chart will be flagged, indicating that she is a study participant
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: prenatal care and labor and delivery will be managed by her physician per standard of care at the physician's discretion
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: routine intrapartum treatment of Group B streptococcus (GBS) colonization using ampicillin
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: randomized in a blinded fashion to Arm 1 (Unasyn) or Arm 2 (ampicillin/gentamicin)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: treated as per standard of care with tylenol, intravenous fluids, and her labor managed per physician discretion
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: receive intravenous antibiotics per the protocol arm to which they have been assigned
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: pregnant women in labor or undergoing induction of labor
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: greater than or equal to 18 years of age
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: allergy or adverse reaction to penicillin or ampicillin, gentamicin, or sulbactam
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: having received antibiotics for the treatment of preterm premature rupture of membranes or other condition within the last 7 days
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 37-year-old woman who came to the clinic for a routine Pap smear. The test revealed stage 1B of cervical cancer.
